page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY OF FORDYCE
page.content:
- PLACES OF INTEREST-
Fordyce Castle,which was built in 1592 by Sir Thomas Menzies,is a picturesque old tower house built with an L-plan structure.The rooms of the main building are original,and decorative mouldings have been revealed in the recent renovations,especially the sculptured monogram of the founder,the Laird of Durn.The Castle has been bought by an American who,at present, lives in Portugal.The 18th century wing of the castle,which was occupied by various tenants up until 1972,has been modernised. Many other houses having links with the past have been restored,e.g.Academy Hse.,Old School Hse.,Anvil Cottage & Haughton Cottage which used to be the old inn.
